cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north tonight, expected to turn north-northeast on Wednesday and then accelerate northeastward up the U.S. East Coast toward the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Steinhatchee River, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect north of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC (well south of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm Warnings confined to the Florida Gulf Coast and immediate Georgia coast (not including the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. East Coast from Florida Big Bend through the Carolinas, Mid-Atlantic, and New England
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (<5%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely gusts 25-35 mph late Thursday night into Friday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal rise (<2 ft) possible along the Delaware River/Upper Delaware Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could drop 1–3 inches in a short period Thursday night–Friday causing localized ponding and drainage issues at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated brief tornadoes cannot be ruled out across the Mid-Atlantic on Friday
